Lorenzen jokes about playing for Cardinals

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 9 p.m. EST December 12, 2014

Feb 9, 2014; Highland Heights, KY, USA; Northern Kentucky River Monsters quarterback Jared Lorenzen during pre game warm up at the Bank of Kentucky Center. Mandatory Credit: Frank Victores-USA TODAY Sports(Photo: Frank Victores-USA TODAY Sports)

1 CONNECT 5 TWEETLINKEDIN 1 COMMENTEMAILMORE

Former University of Kentucky quarterback Jared Lorenzen's comments about the University of Louisville Cardinals' football injuries gained national attention earlier this year.

This week, it was another bunch of Cardinals the NFL's from Arizona that Lorenzen, uh, weighed in on in regard to an injury.

Arizona quarterback Drew Stanton hurt his right knee Thursday night in relief of Carson Palmer, who was already out because of a knee injury. That led to an idea from the Hefty Lefty, who tweeted, "Hey @AZCardinals I can be ready to leave in the morning. Fair warning it may take a week or 2 to get back to playing weight."

Lorenzen added "#justplaying" to his post and then sent two more: "Workouts start tonight. Just a few more lbs to go. Don't u worry AZ fans I'm on my way. #dontcallitacomeback

"Good night twitter. Enough fun for one night. In all seriousness I hope @drewstanton is ok and comes back. That's a good team."

Workouts start tonight. Just a few more lbs to go. Don't u worry AZ fans I'm on my way. #dontcallitacomebackpic.twitter.com/sUcG8FyuU3

— jared lorenzen (@JaredLorenzen22) December 12, 2014

At age 33, Lorenzen's storied football career is likely over, at least on the field. The former Highlands High School, UK and NFL player suffered a knee injury of his own earlier this year playing for the Northern Kentucky River Monsters of the Continental Indoor Football League.

Lorenzen, though, does have a Super Bowl ring from his time as the New York Giants' backup.

"Last time the Super Bowl was in #Arizona I was there. It there again this year. Looks like a sign to me. #SBXLII#XLIX," he chimed in with Friday morning.

Last time the Super Bowl was in #Arizona I was there. It there again this year. Looks like a sign to me. #SBXLII#XLIX

— jared lorenzen (@JaredLorenzen22) December 12, 2014

Anyway, the Associated Press reported Friday that Stanton's ailment won't require surgery, and that coach Bruce Arians said his signal caller "definitely has a chance" to see the field again this season. Sorry, Jared.
